page.title: 04HINTON HOUSE:H.CHARTERHOUSE
page.content: THE LARGEST, AND MOST IMPORTANT BUILDING IN THE VILLAGE, IS{HINTON {HOUSE.}IT USED TO BE THE GRANGE OF HINTON PRIORY, BUT IT HAS NOW BEEN DIVIDED INTO THREE FLATS AND A MAIN LIVING AREA. THERE ARE SIX PERMANENT RESIDENTS IN THE HOUSE, AND SOME TEMPORARY ONES. ON THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE IS AN ORANGERY, WHICH NOW CONTAINS PLANTS SUCH AS GERANIUMS. THE OWNERS TEND TO MOST OF THE GARDENS, WHICH TAKE UP NINE ACRES, ALTHOUGH ONE OF THE VILLAGE BOYS LOOKS AFTER THE LAWNS. THE GARDENS ARE NOT OPEN TO THE PUBLIC. THE OWNERS ALSO LOOK AFTER THE BUSINESS SIDE OF THE FARMS. THERE IS PLENTY OF THE USUAL WILDLIFE e.g.SQUIRRELS, RABBITS AND A LOT OF ROOKS, AROUND THE GROUNDS. IT IS NOT UNCOMMON TO FIND A BEES' NEST SOMEWHERE IN THE HOUSE.
